metadata.dc:author: Fariña Conde, J L
Ibarra Urbieta, J I
Espiña Campos, G
Pérez-Carro Rios, A
Sánchez Ruiz, D
Araujo Nores, J
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE The aim of this study is to value the hearing results obtained in our department following stapedectomy and the reasons of primary failures. MATERIAL AND METHOD We present a retrospective study of 95 stapedectomies in 82 patients, performed from January 1997 to September 2002 at Hospital Xeral-Cies of Vigo (Pontevedra). RESULTS Medium presurgical audiometric threshold was 65.71 and postsurgical 26.68. Good results were obtained in 84.21% of cases (air-bone gap closure difference under 20 dB), 10.52% had not change in air threshold and the rest deteriorated. CONCLUSIONS We compare our results with other authors and we consider that stapedectomy is a safe surgical technique, but it has important complications and they have to be bear in mind to prevent them.
metadata.dc:title: Estapedectomía: nuestros resultados.
[Stapedectomy: our results].
